SEARCH
Module com.jp.passwordmanager
Package passwordmanager.database

Class DatabaseAPI

java.lang.Object
passwordmanager.database.DatabaseAPI
public class DatabaseAPI extends Object
The DatabaseAPI class provides methods for interacting with a database to perform various operations related to managing entries and common email addresses within a password manager application.

Instances of this class are obtained using the getInstance() method. This class ensures safe database operations and encapsulates SQL statements for adding, modifying, removing, and retrieving data related to entries and common emails.

Note: This class follows the singleton design pattern to ensure only one instance is created throughout the application.

Usage example: 

 
 DatabaseAPI dbAPI = DatabaseAPI.getInstance();
 dbAPI.newEntry("example title", "email@example.com", "password123", "username", "http://example.com", "example category");
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DatabaseAPI getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the DatabaseAPI class.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the DatabaseAPI.

    • newEntry

      public void newEntry(String title, String email, String password, String username, String link, String category)
      Adds a new entry to the database.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the entry.
      email - the email associated with the entry.
      password - the password of the entry.
      username - the username associated with the entry.
      link - a hyperlink associated with the entry, if any.
      category - the category to which the entry belongs.

    • newEntry

      public void newEntry(Entry entry)
      Adds a new entry to the database.
      Parameters:
      entry - the entry object to be added.

    • modifyEntry

      public void modifyEntry(String title, String email, String password, String username, String link, String category)
      Modifies an existing entry in the database. Parameters that do not need to be changed should be passed in as null.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the entry to modify.
      email - the new email to update.
      password - the new password to update.
      username - the new username to update.
      link - the new link to update.
      category - the new category to update.

    • removeEntry

      public void removeEntry(String title)
      Removes an entry from the database.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the entry to remove.

    • getEntry

      public Entry getEntry(String titleKey)
      Retrieves an entry from the database based on its title.
      Parameters:
      titleKey - the title of the entry to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Entry object corresponding to the title, or null if not found.

    • getAllEntries

      public ArrayList<Entry> getAllEntries()
      Retrieves all entries from the database.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all entries, or null if an error occurs.

    • getListOfEntryTitles

      public ArrayList<String> getListOfEntryTitles()
      Retrieves a list of all entry titles from the database.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all entry titles, or null if an error occurs.

    • addCommonEmail

      public void addCommonEmail(String email)
      Adds a common email address to the database.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address to add to the common emails list.

    • getListOfCommonEmails

      public ArrayList<String> getListOfCommonEmails()
      Retrieves a list of common emails from the database. This method executes a SQL query prepared by prepareGetListOfCommonEmailsStatement from the sqlStatementBuilder to fetch all common emails stored in the database. The emails are read from the result set and added to an ArrayList.

      This method handles any SQL exceptions by printing the stack trace and returns null if an exception occurs, indicating that the operation failed.

      Returns:
      An ArrayList<String> containing all the common emails retrieved from the database, or null if an SQL exception occurs.

    • getListOfGroups

      public Set<String> getListOfGroups()
      Retrieves a list of all groups from the database. This method executes a SQL query prepared by prepareGetListOfGroupsStatement from the sqlStatementBuilder to fetch all groups stored in the database. The groups are read from the result set and added to a HashSet.

      This method handles any SQL exceptions by printing the stack trace and returns null if an exception occurs, indicating that the operation failed.

      Returns:
      A Set<String> containing all the groups retrieved from the database, or null if an SQL exception occurs.
